website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight and practical pop-up multi-purpose shower utility tent that's more than spacious enough for changing.
pros: Travel-ready pop-up shower tent weighing just 4.4 lb
It sports an integrated clothesline, small pouch for storing items, and removable floor mat
Constructed from steel frame and 191 D nylon polyester material, which is weather resistant
cons: No opening for existing shower head or hose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: Very good value for the price. Our favorite thing is that you have complete privacy if you are bathing or simply changing your clothes. And it stops the cold wind! It does bend in the wind so stake it down well. Also, there is a slight learning curve on folding it to put away. We will be using for our Walk Across America 2020 starting in March... Rob and Marvy (RobandMarvy.com)
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Addition
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent for changing clothes, showering or using as a privy tent with a camping toilet. BUT . . . The instruction pamphlet clearly states that there is a hole in the mesh roof for a shower hose to feed through. Mine has no hole. Not a huge deal, but I didn't expect to have to cut my own hole and superglue mesh threads to keep it from unraveling. Another thing that I've come to expect over the years - the so called "stakes" are a joke. 6" long heavy wire coat hanger better describes them. Invest in some real stakes so you don't have to chase the tent across the campgrounds as everyone laughs at you.
customer_reviews.author: The_Tech_Son

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even better company!
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this tent. The easiest ever set up and tear down! We were camping recently, and a freak snow storm hit us. The tent survived really intense wind, but we did have to take it down eventually when the storm wasn't letting up. It definitely exceeded my expectations though. The top part of the tent got torn in all the hubbub of dealing with the storm. It was not at all an issue with the product, just an accident. I emailed WolfWise to ask if I could purchase a new top, and they sent me a replacement, no questions asked. What a wonderful company! I am so pleased--and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Only used once and metal popped out!
customer_reviews.text: We used changing tent only once, we opened it up and it stood weird. We packed it back up and heard a pop and saw the bottom metal back popped out of the metal retaining band. Update: Wolfwise Customer Service is awesome and resolved my issue quickly. I give them 5 stars for quick response, A+ for quickly resolving my issue. I must have received a bad batch. I do warn, the canopy's material can be damaged easily. We already have a hole on the wall, I guess we'll duct tape it. That's why I had to give it 4 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: dinosmongoose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pop up tent
customer_reviews.text: I used it as a changing room. It was so easy to put up. It looks great too. I am very impressed with it. It was a bit of a challenge to get it back in the bag but we finally did it, and laughed at ourselves the whole time, so it was definitely entertaining!
customer_reviews.author: roxannier

customer_reviews.title: Great little privacy tent
customer_reviews.text: Great little privacy tent. I used it as an outhouse with aduring a camping trip to make an "outhouse." I also used it as a place to take a "cowboy shower." The little floor was a good barrier so I wasn't stepping on grass. We called it the "TURDIS." LOL This and the portable toilet really made for a good camping experience for me.
customer_reviews.author: jynclr

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have only used this a hand full of times but it has been serving its purpose for a portable restroom. I do a lot of camping and off roading. Some of the areas we go don't have either actual restrooms and or places to "go" so I take this tent with us where ever we go and never have to worry about it. Haven't used as a shower yet but can defiantly be used for that and a changing room. Very easy pop up and down by yourself with storage case to take anywhere. I'm defiantly glad I have added this tent to my camping supplies
customer_reviews.author: Fitzy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Sorry that I can't provide a video of my husband putting this away. I was too busy trying not to wet my pants. To make it worse, the tag showing how 'easy' it is to fold up features a woman. That 15 minutes of entertainment was worth the cost and then some. Use used this for a potty tent. It was perfect. Don't expect the included pegs to hold it in place in a gust of wind. It didn't hold for us. Fortunately, we weren't in it at the time. Not sure where a shower bag would hang but for a potty it was great!
customer_reviews.author: L. Warburton

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste ur money on this ⛺
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this tent, so far it's been up for 2 weeks and almost very time a strong winds come, it falls down. I have tied it down and still no good. Also I'm 5'9 around 200lb, and inside very tight. Will ot buy again, but will order the same I bought last summer. PS... I use the tent to change into swimming shorts so we don't walk into the house drip wet.
customer_reviews.author: Firas-13

customer_reviews.title: One other thing I dislike is trying to fold it back into a shape ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the quality, it's just too small for my taste. For the price, I'll live with it until I can find something larger. One other thing I dislike is trying to fold it back into a shape that will fit in back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Tent
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tent for camping to use with a porta-potty. The tent opens super quick and easy (folding back is a challenge until you get the hang. There is a great video on YouTube). There is plenty of room on the inside and I do not feel cramped at all. My only complaint is that there is no screen on the 2 half moon ventilation windows. If you want to open them for some airflow on warm day/nights then you are bombarded with bugs. This design failure is the only thing keeping me from a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M.

customer_reviews.title: Unbeliievably cheap POS
customer_reviews.text: I looked at the description before I bought it, and I didn't expect much for the cost, but what was received, well... I managed to get it up, noting how it was arranged, it's pretty short for me, I'm 6 feet 3 inches, and I thought, what the heck, it's easier to set up then my big shower tent, then I tried to get it back in it's stuff sack. Read the instructions which are little more than pencil drawing illustrations, and spent over an hour wrestling with it, never did get it folded, stuffed it in a box and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to use this tent
customer_reviews.text: Received the privacy shelter tent and found that the seller sent me an old model of the tent without the rain cover and floor, even though I paid for the upgraded model. Would have loved to use the tent, but without all the features listed, it doesn't fit my needs. Very disappointed!! It also appears the the green color I wanted is now sold out. Not happy. On the plus side, Amazon customer service was very helpful and sent me the return shipping label within 5 minutes of being notified of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: We know how to get these types of products folded back up. But between the two of us we cannot make it happen with this darned thing. Actually spent an hour and watching videos, and got it back in the bag, but it isn’t right. It refuses to fold up properly.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: A much needed camp item!
customer_reviews.text: Camping can be a real drag if you don't carry the right gear. This privacy tent is a must-have for showering in the wild. There is even dedicated space inside for your towel and toiletries while you get wet. And if it's bathroom privacy you want, it works great with a Luggable Loo. Pops right out into an outhouse in seconds, folds up in about 1 minute (once you get the hang of it). Fits nicely into the carrying backpack provided with purchase. Also has tent stakes and a cover for various weather conditions. The only downside is the door could go a little higher. Everything else is just right. You must get this!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie C. Kruczek

customer_reviews.title: Stitching is poor. I just unboxed my tent and the first ...
customer_reviews.text: Stitching is poor. I just unboxed my tent and the first thing that I saw was that the stitching on the storage pouch was not secure (see photo) as it has opened up in a couple of places. This is even before I have opened up the plastic packaging that it was shipped in. I am very disappointed with the quality of workmanship of this product. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Devika Bally

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Campsites
customer_reviews.text: Whether you're looking to have a private dressing area or privacy over a camping toilet, this is a great solution! It opens very easily, and can be secured to avoid it toppling over during windy conditions. Folding it takes getting used to and the provided instructions weren't helpful. Now as for the zippers, they are definitely not the most durable, so you'll need to be mindful when opening and closing the tent to avoid pulling them off. One other oddity was that the zippers on the windows are only able to be open from the interior. Overall, this product met my needs as an addition to my camping supplies.
customer_reviews.author: jncweller

customer_reviews.title: The wires bent the same day I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: This was the 3rd one of these pop up shower tent I’ve bought to try. I’m planning a big road trip/ camping trip throughout the country, so I’m taking my time to make sure I get the right one. The other brands I’ve bought had small details I did not like and it was cheaper than this. But this one was the worst out of all of them. I loved it when I first opened it and set it up. But when it comes to folding it back back in, the wires bent just on the first step per instructions (folding it in half from top to bottom). Returning it immediately. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Models Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I'm always traveling , and I keep it in my trunk for when I'm doing outdoor shoots. Me and other models use it too. We all love it Update: Its still holding on strong ! I swear I abuse this tent more times than I can count, it has never failed me and it's NOT SEE THROUGH , some tents I have to put another cover to make sure the sun doesn't show my reflection through the tents but thus tent is perfect. No one can see me and there's enough room to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Nguyen (Brii Zee)

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, sturdy, easy to store and set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. It took a few tries to learn to fold it; definitely follow the directions the first time. Now it's a snap! This is extremely functional on the job when we set up, sometimes for hours, at a manhole. We can sit inside in shade on a sunny day, or dry on a drizzly day, with the computer and other electronic equipment. It can also be zipped up for privacy to change wet clothes or use the potty bucket. I can attest to the excellence of this shelter. I wish we had bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Chapulina R

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Because of the quarantine, we have found this tent very handy. Our son has a five acre field where we can picnic but there is no hook-ups yet, so we bought this tent and a potty chair to go with it. It is easily to set up and easy to clean. My husband also built a floor for it. and we have a basket full of handy wipes etc. JBM
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase, no regrets
customer_reviews.text: The BEST product for camping! I have three little kids so having this as our “outdoor tent bathroom cover” was perfect. It was worth the price compared to other products similar to this brand. Easy to put up and I love the inside pocket for your extra stuff. There are also two possible venting windows if you chose to open. That’s not including the top which is netted and Allows for nice air flow. But there is a cover to go over the top if you choose. Highly recommend, will never go camping without it again!
customer_reviews.author: suzette

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful addition to our camping gear
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful addition to our camping gear! We purchased it for the recent solar eclipse, we camped at a public park and with over one million people coming to Oregon for the event; we knew to take extra precautions. In essence, we had our own private toilet!!!
customer_reviews.author: WoodStockGranny

customer_reviews.title: It's not even remotely easy to put away
customer_reviews.text: It's nowhere's near as sturdy as the one that I was planning to replace it with. You need a minor in oragami to put the tent back in the circular zipper pouch that's about 1/6th the size of the tent. My old one had a zipper mesh roof so I can open it up to drop the shower head into it. This one doesn't have that. I'm really sorry that I bought this and will be returning it once I figure out how to get the entire tent in a circle shape instead of just 4/5ths of it in a circular shape.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Look Elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Fabric tore on the first outing. Unfortunately it was just outside of the short Amazon return window so I cannot get it exchanged.
customer_reviews.author: Ough My Friend!

customer_reviews.title: I was excited to use this.
customer_reviews.text: I have been camping all my 48 years. Took this camping. Then the wind blew mildly. The stakes stayed in the ground along with the attached loops. Only one of the anchor loops was held in place by very poor sewing. The tent folded on its own and laid flat on the ground. I decided to stitch and reinforce all four corners to get through the rest of the weekend. If you don't mind re-ataching the loops like I did or if your gonna use this indoors, you will like it. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AspenRain

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sturdy POP UP privacy shelter...
customer_reviews.text: Right now it is in my car. Should I have to go I have a nice privacy shelter to place my pota pity... I heard fast foods and restaurants are not allowing people in to use the restroom.... This would be a great item for camping... Very easy to pop up and down.. Sturdy has a floor, lightweight, windows.. A great little tent to have on had should you need privacy for anything.... Love this purchase and am pleased I got the best BANG for my BUCK.
customer_reviews.author: NACORN

customer_reviews.title: Love the tent but it difficult to fold
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited to use this! I love all the features and it is really quite big inside! The only thing is that it is really difficult to learn to put away. I had to watch the video a number of times to get it. On the inside of the storage bag is a code you can scan to watch a video about it. That was very helpful. I felt like I was going to break it but it worked. Great product!! I hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Camping must have!
customer_reviews.text: we camped out far from a bathroom and this was the perfect solution. We set it up right by our second entrance to the tent with composting toilet. There was plenty of room for extra bucket for cedar shavings and trashcan/what have you. Plenty of room for parent to go in to help a little one. The hanging storage pocket was helpful for hand purifier and flashlight. We definitely used the floor attachment which helps with the nighttime creepy crawler factor. We got some heavier duty stakes because we had some bad weather. It held up just fine. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: straps to hold it down come apart
customer_reviews.text: After 3 uses the material that holds the tent pegs came apart. Reality is the seam that holds the cloth to the tent was held by a single set of stitches, so when it became windy they loosened immediately. They need to improve the stitching on the tent to withhold some level of windy. I don't expect high gusts, but minor wind should be tolerated and multiple stitching across the seams would have done the trick. Otherwise it is a great tent, easy to fold, easy to set up, easy to use - too bad the little details were not taken into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Kanasatka

customer_reviews.title: A Camping Must Have!!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my best purchases ever! I bring this, along with my Luggable Loo, camping and it is a must for tent/pop up camper camping. I recently camped at a KOA campground where the bathrooms had to be at least 3 blocks away. Using this in the middle of the night on my campsite was awesome. We also used it as a changing room. Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: KimBee

customer_reviews.title: Too Thin for My Privacy Preference
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. We used it for camping. I gave it 3 Stars because I think the material is too thin. With enough lighting in the background or inside the tent, you can actually see the silhouette of the person undressing, changing, or stooping down to use the bathroom. That just defeats the purpose of why we bought this in the first place! For this price, I think they could afford to double-layer or thicken the material for better privacy.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B

customer_reviews.title: Well mad easy to erect not ideal in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: Goes up easy, provides privacy, sturdy but not ideal for windy conditions. We used this remote camping on the beach. The wind was a problem. We found it easier to lay it flat on the beach when not in use. When we needed it we stood it up then laid it back down to keep it from being damaged or blown away by the wind. I think if we had erected it on the lee side of our tent it would have worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Credx2

customer_reviews.title: quick to setup quick to put away
customer_reviews.text: i work in telecomunications and do a lot of work in underground cable and a lot of times get stuck having to work in the rain saw another tech online using one of these to set up over a terminal when it rains so i got it and i am impressed it takes just a few seconds to pop it up and set it right over the terminal im working at and it comes with the rain flap to cover the top and super quick and easy to fold up instructions are very easy to understand also would definitely recomend this to anyone it has so many uses
customer_reviews.author: Nick636n8r

customer_reviews.title: Nice toilet enclosure for camping
customer_reviews.text: This pop-up tent has provided us more flexibility in where we can go camping in our van since we don't have on-board toilet facilities. We put a port-a-potty inside so we don't have to find our way to a campground outhouse in the middle of the night -- and also reduces our possible exposure to germs encountered in public toilets. I like that his has an optional rain cover & detachable floor. It's nice to just be able to shake off the square floor cover before putting it away. My only criticism is that it is tricky to fold & I had to look at a couple YouTube videos to get it figured out.
customer_reviews.author: BevB

customer_reviews.title: Change tent for surfing
customer_reviews.text: I have always used a towel to shimmy from street clothes to wetsuit and back. It is a revealing and weird process, especially for women since it is not acceptable to reveal your bare top half on the street AND I like to be modest and not interested in drawing attention. This change tent is so great for that purpose. I've used it quite a bit even to change from work to fitness or from a beach day to a going out night. It pops up in seconds, and folding it becomes so simple once you get the steps on the image. One of my favorite items for my car.
customer_reviews.author: Kelpy

customer_reviews.title: Not great for a portable shower enclosure,  jus sayn
customer_reviews.text: Ok people here's the thing, the tent is perfect for a changing room for camping or beach. It is even ok for a pop up bathroom with the proper potro accoutrements. However, the thought of using this as a portable shower enclosure is absurd. Think: naked, standing, soapy, semi- encapsulated ,slip n slide probably in mud . Lets just say it was a humbling experience.
customer_reviews.author: nintendomom1972

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew this product earlier.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my client outdoor photo session. It’s portable and easy to setup. However it’s a little hard to twist and fold back. I am keeping it at the back of my back truck all the time now. Can be very handy like going to beach and changing after hiking etc. The height is perfect. A 6 foot man can change inside with no problem. five star.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Has some quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled with how easy and quick it was to assemble and to fold back up. One video was all it took. However, the 1st time I put a bottle of soap in the soap pouch it ripped out the stitching. The elastic for the towel holder isn’t strong enough to hold a towel either. The largest problem however was with the zipper . I don’t know if I just got a lemon or if it’s like this with all the tents but the zipper keeps getting stuck and is pretty much useless. We have to leave it unzipped or pick the tent up to get out. Got to say the Idea is great workmanship is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie A.

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is only good for one or two uses, after that it's all bent and starts tilting over. It was GREAT the first 2 times we used it, I was so happy, but after that - it's just garbage that falls over... and won't even fold anymore.
customer_reviews.author: amzreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Multiple great features
customer_reviews.text: Love this shower tent. Ready to use in 10 seconds (a minute if you want to stake it down). Love the mesh ceiling. The little pocket is perfect for holding soap and also worked to hold shower head. The towel bar was handy. Very easy to zip and unzip. Dries super quick and very easy to put away. I found the folding instructions confusing at first. I recommend checking some youtube videos on how to fold the tent back up and trying it a couple of times to see which technique works best for you.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Hesitant to purchase, but after one camping trip, we are sold
customer_reviews.text: Hesitant to purchase, but after years of trying to hang tarps from trees for privacy screens so we can use our sun shower, I decided to give it try. One trip out, convinced us we will never leave on another camping trip with out it. Lightweight, very easy to set up and stake, wonderful having a floor cover, had no problem with the wind knocking it over...now the folding up of the privacy tent takes some practice...but once you get the hang of it..no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Fall

customer_reviews.title: Portable but not for windy conditions
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as easy to fold. I have used it twice and opened it up once indoors. It always feels like I’m bending it incorrectly before it folds completely. I guess I have to get used to it. The one time I took it to the beach it collapsed. It was a little windy so I’ll give it the benefit of the doubt. I do like the fact that it’s easy to set up and carry. Hopefully it does not collapse when in use. 😳
customer_reviews.author: Bosslady

customer_reviews.title: bad zippers and stitching . may be used
customer_reviews.text: easy setup for sure . bigger around then expected . holds up to wind well . . I suspect this unit has been used do to some imperfections . must have been a return or something .but the seller sent a replacement quickly . pretty good customer service
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tall enough!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a portable shower tent tall enough for my 6'1" height. No worries with this tent. Don't throw away the storage instructions until you have put it away a few times. It comes with a top fly and a floor sheet to stand on. I would like to see toggles to hold the floor sheet in place. It almost sets itself up!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan I.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us!
customer_reviews.text: Used as a changing room and where the camp toilet sat while pickup canopy camping. Works great. Quite roomy inside. Save a link on how to fold it for storage. The video link saved us from looking like crazy people as we attempted to fold it up.
customer_reviews.author: RBuck

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when I got this item yesterday. Many of the seams are broken and the zippers stuck midway. After a great deal of work, I was able to fix all the problems that should have been caught by a quality control person. I am only 5' 10" and my head touches the roof of this thing. It's very short and not something I would enjoy using. I will keep it since I have it but I won't order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Love this changing room
customer_reviews.text: I love this pop up changing room. I have a tear drop trailer and with this I can change my clothes easily. The tent is very easy to set up and take down( watch YouTube videos first). The inner coating makes it very hard to see through. Ventilation is good. I bought a different brand and quickly sent it back for very poor workmanship. I also made a port a potty (YouTube) and put it inside, plenty of room for it and changing. Buy different stakes, though.
customer_reviews.author: kathy Wolfinbarger

customer_reviews.title: Portable Privy Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: I loved that I can one twist turn this into a flat round disc and store it quickly. Works just like my sun screen for my car! It was the perfect solution to be able to take the grandkids out for a road trip and keep them isolated and safe during this Covid 19 era. To be honest - I was happy to have it too and not have to hike to a central restroom building across the camp ground. I bought a pota potty chair that also stood up with a seat and plastic bags for our waste. QUick wipe down and now its packed and ready for the next Nana Adventure with the Grandkids!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Loper

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: This was made so cheaply and was only able to use it on two camp trips before both zippers broke...and if I'd known before this was made in China I'd have never bought it in the first place. Not to mention how easy it WASN'T to fold back up and put away. At one point I wanted to throw it off the cliff...so don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: difloyd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping or the beach!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping or the beach!This is awesome plenty a room to change and we used to camp in Rhyda Porter party plenty a room for any size person, came in pretty damn handy so we didn’t have to walk to the potty house in the rain.My granddaughter loved changing in this instead of in the bathhouse
customer_reviews.author: double L

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I’m so excited to use it at my next photoshoot. It has plenty of room & it is great quality. Will makes changing outfits at photoshoots much easier. I’m not sure why so many reviews said it was difficult to fold...I got it folded in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Idea
customer_reviews.text: This is really an excellent idea for a convenient privacy tent. The size is small when folded up. I use it for my Mini Van RV conversion car camping. Plus it can used with a portable toilet for emergencies, camping, and even multi day out door festivals. It is a little hard to put back in the holder the first time but i watched a you tube video and that helped. I bought this one because i did want the option of having a floor in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: D. Judy

customer_reviews.title: Quick & easy once you get the hang of folding it up
customer_reviews.text: We used for a socially distant road trip in order to avoid stopping at public bathrooms. This sets up in seconds. Folding it is more challenging, but my husband got his system down after the first few tries and after that it didn't take long. Good size, easy to slide into car around suitcases.
customer_reviews.author: A Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: it worked well as a outhouse for my porta-potty
customer_reviews.text: it can be used for a porta-potty or a shower ten. it took a bit to get it to fold back into the carrying case. But I have the same issues with tents and their bags too! I could just be challenged when it comes to putting stuff in their original carrying cases also. But it does a good job of privacy and that is what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Doe

customer_reviews.title: Great size & easy once you practice!
customer_reviews.text: Do not try to follow written instructions for folding back up. Watch you tube video. Once you try it a couple of times at home you can reduce it to 3 easy steps: 1. flatten on ground 2. roll bottom toards top and 3. fold into circle & stow away! Great size, love that you can take or leave the rain fly and/or bottom mat. Wish windows & door had mesh tho to keep out bugs
customer_reviews.author: Mystified in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Nervous About Grocery Shopping in the Age of Pandemics?
customer_reviews.text: A must have if you're worried about public bathrooms! Carry this baby around and when the urge hits, stop the car, toss up the tent, add a porta-potty (or 5 gallon pail, you cheap-skate) and let nature take over. Seriously? You'll want to practice folding the tent a few times. It's easy once you learn the tricks.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: This is a good size, plenty of room to shower in
customer_reviews.text: This is a good size, plenty of room to shower in. Two complaints. 1) The instructions for collapsing the tent that are SEWN into the carry bag are very unclear and not helpful. After getting pretty frustrated I looked up a video online and it turn out it folds down very easily. However, the paper instructions it comes with are correct. Just didn't see them until after the fact. 2) I wish there were a couple ties inside the tent, really could use one on the ceiling somewhere to be able to hang an LED.
customer_reviews.author: Cody + Gabbi

customer_reviews.title: Get it if you value your outdoors privacy
customer_reviews.text: It's really easy to set-up and take down. It fits one full grown adult up to 6 feet comfortably. It comes with anchoring steaks but they are not always useful. I would like it better if it came with some sort of weighted grounding flaps or something; I could easily rig this but it might make the ease of popping it open and close slightly difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Lex Xor

customer_reviews.title: Will be very useful and easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: This will be so useful for adventures! I purchased this privacy tent to use for outdoors showers at the beach and camping. Since the plan is to be barefoot for showers, I love the removable floor option. I also really like the carrying case with the backpack straps attached. The only thing missing is the towel line from the pictures. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: RWT Reviews

customer_reviews.title: easy up and semingly well made
customer_reviews.text: Used as both shower tent and water closet this fall ion extended Moab trip Having an enclosure for the camp toilet was quite a treat given the amount of rain we experienced Removable floor is nice if you need / want a floor for use with a camp toilet but nee quick and easy removal for shower duty. Agree with previous reviews that the included stakes are a joke, but that's easily fixed. At a really good price point it won't be devastating if it blows away or gets shredded in the wind
customer_reviews.author: Wade Bigall

customer_reviews.title: Super quick set up AND pack away
customer_reviews.text: We have only tested it inside so far - putting up and packing away a couple of times. Packing away definitely needs the instructions - but they worked, and it took us about a minute to put up and a minute to pack down - without the separate rain fly. This quick and easy deployment will meet our need for a roadside privacy shelter with small kids on long drive. Seems good quality material. Fiddliest part was the door ties which aren’t elastic - but great price for this product.
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We set up the changing tent in less than 8 seconds. It's a very clever design and easy to use. Now we're able to go out to remote areas for kayaking and have our own private secure changing tent and commode tent. My husband is a big guy and 6'3 and it works perfectly for him as well.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Waters

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dollar!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with little expectations. My purpose for this tent is to have a clean dressing room available when we go to Amusment Parks and to Beaches. It's difficult changing in the car and having a mix of boys and girls changing rooms are difficult because I can't help the boys if needed. This tent was well worth the money, it did exactly what I needed it to do. It is very light so the wind was a challenge but we used the hatch of the SUV to keep it down and someone held the side, not a big deal. I am not at all disappointed in the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Pitcock

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for using to change or to use for portable toilet setup for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Worked great for a privacy portable toilet setup. Great ventilation. Liked that the two side zip windows were at different heights, at sitting level and standing level. The top has mesh. Wish the side windows also had zippered mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Works but not good enough!
customer_reviews.text: So the item does what it needs to do but if there is a good amount of wind it will not stay up. The tie-down do kinda help but they seem to tie to high on the product. When you tie it down and there is wind because the ties are so high when the wind blows it makes it fold into its self. Also, one of the tie-downs pulled off first use. So, it does what it needs to do if there is no wind. Past my return time so I will have to buy a better option with some kind of frame.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Works for well for a privacy shelter
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice if there were loops to tie it off higher on the sides. We used it camping where it was too rocky for tent stakes and it was really windy. It almost blew over while using the privy even when weighted down with cat litter and 5 gallons of water. Would like to be able to tie it off to a tree. FYI, definitely make sure to watch the video on how to fold it. It takes a few tries to be able to fold it up without swearing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Window zippers are a joke. Not functional!
customer_reviews.text: **Updated Added 1 star for great customer service. Company reached out to fix my problem. This does the job when you gotta do your business out in the desert but don’t expect much here. Overall quality is bad, do not open the window zippers, they will not close ever again, the zippers are that cheap. I had to use gorilla tape to close the windows. The door zipper is more heavy duty and is holding up ok, for now.
customer_reviews.author: Patric

customer_reviews.title: Seams ripped after four uses- metal frame popped out.
customer_reviews.text: We used this over the weekend for group hikes, and exactly one month after purchase, after four weekend trips, the seams split! We had been gentle with it and had used it only as a potty tent for kids, so this was definitely an issue of defect/failure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got this tent as a shower cover for outside ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this tent as a shower cover for outside when camping. It is very well constructed and stitch nylon. Very roomy inside. Comes with a ground sheet and cover for the roof. Ground states are also included. My family will get lots of use of this product this summer.
customer_reviews.author: britchick

customer_reviews.title: It's light-weight and easy to deploy and collapse
customer_reviews.text: It's light-weight and easy to deploy and collapse...as long as you follow the directions. We used it as a shower and toilet enclosure and it worked very well for both. The floor material is pretty light-weight, so we kept the detached floor back out of the way and set the toilet on the ground. During showers, we removed the toilet and put the floor in place. Plan on buying four real stakes to hold it down. The reviews are correct regarding the quality of the stakes that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Utah Man

customer_reviews.title: Portable Actors' Changing Room!
customer_reviews.text: As a struggling actor, I sometimes have to go to several auditions in a day, often changing my clothes to suit the character in the breakdown. It's not uncommon in Hollywood to see a man or a woman in a business district changing their clothes in their car (hardly the place for comfort or privacy), and those in the now in L.A. understand this uncomfortable ritual for actors. The Pop Up Privacy tent allows a quick, private dressing room that can be put up and taken down almost instantly. This thing is amazing. I love how it folds up in a circle in no time. See you in the movies!!
customer_reviews.author: michael ross

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t always fold easy, but eventually you get there.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great when your camping and others are around. Folding was a different story. We both tried several times before or finally worked. All in all, we like this product and would recommend it. It will probably get easier to fold the more we use it. The thing we use it most for is to shower in and wish it had a hanger higher up above the zipper slot to hang the head on, but hey, we aren’t glamming. Get one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s meant for
customer_reviews.text: We went camping. Same as with others if their is wind you must anchore it down. Does what it’s meant for. Though I didn’t like the width of it. Next time I’ll buy a wider one.
customer_reviews.author: lilly

customer_reviews.title: Instant privacy
customer_reviews.text: Combined this pop up tent with a portable toilet while camping in order to avoid the communal pit toilet. Eased some Covid anxiety. Went up just fine, but it took 2 of us to wrestle it back into the bag when it was time to leave. Felt like the game Twister. All in all, totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Larella Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good shower tent
customer_reviews.text: More room in there than I expected. Not sure how it will hold up in the wind, but otherwise feeling good about this purchase. I like that it comes with a detachable floor. Easy to pop up. A little tricky to fold down but you get the hang of it after a time or two.
customer_reviews.author: Ivynana

customer_reviews.title: Really handy! But can’t refold it!
customer_reviews.text: It just pops right up—no real assembly needed. I had planned to put in my disaster prep kit as a potty tent, but I found another use! As a changing tent for our garage sale! Only problem—I can’t get it back in it’s carry case! :-(
customer_reviews.author: Denise Pen

customer_reviews.title: I love the WolfWise Pop Up Tent
customer_reviews.text: I love the WolfWise Pop Up Tent!! We live in Oregon and use this tent as a restroom while camping. We put a portable camp commode inside and it is the perfect setup. With this privacy tent you can use the restroom anywhere. We tied it down near Yellowstone when winds were high and it stood firm without moving. It has proper ventilation and no smell. I have also used this tent as a sun shelter from the heat when watching my boyfriend go fishing. Just roll up the front entrance and put a chair inside and you are protected from the sun. I would absolutely recommend Wofwise pop up tent.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Pops open in two seconds!
customer_reviews.text: I love my potty tent. It pops right open. The stakes they give you won't hold in the Utah wind, but we found larger, heartier stakes and they work great. That's the only downfall, is the cheap stakes. It impossible to get it back in the bag, but we load it just folded, not in the circle bag it's supposed to go into. We'll figure that out when we have more time!
customer_reviews.author: P. K. K.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Before this tent we had to fish near restrooms because my family is all girls now we just set it up put the portable inside and presto,the only down side to this tent is when the sun hits it just right there is silhouette folding it back up is little tough but there is plenty of videos on how to fold it back
customer_reviews.author: roland

customer_reviews.title: Great for a rest stop free Covid road trip
customer_reviews.text: I used this (with a portable potty) to avoid stopping and going inside any rest areas as we made a 1200 trip. It was easy to use and pack. It’s a little tricky to get the hang of refolding, but it was really easy once I figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: indulgent grandma

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: What a great find. It is sturdy and tall enough to stand and move around. It is a little difficult to close back up however once you figure it out you wonder why you have trouble in the first place. We plan to use this as our midnight potty while camping.
customer_reviews.author: T. Arns

customer_reviews.title: Good tent, practice closing it a lot
customer_reviews.text: All and all not a bad little tent for the price. It takes a bunch of times to learn to fold it, so practice a bunch before the day you need to use it. We got this tent for my daughter to change her dance costumes in at her dance shows. I would say it serves its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Embarrass your kids but stay dry!
customer_reviews.text: Soccer mom here. My daughter is 13 and just dies when I drag this out but know what!?! Other parents are like “whoah...soooo smart.” I’m dry. I’m warm. I’m embarrassing my kid. Does soccer get any better?!!
customer_reviews.author: Veeeeeehhhh

customer_reviews.title: No Shower Head Attachment Above You
customer_reviews.text: It’s well made with material that I hope will stand up to UV but is a bit short and doesn’t have a way to hold a shower head above you (which is why I purchased it). I guess it’ll work but could be better
customer_reviews.author: Mr Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Multi-Function Tiny Room + Recording Studio
customer_reviews.text: In addition to being a super-warm office in the cold of winter, it's a purdy durned good lil recording studio. If you put a comforter over it (as I did) and a mat on the floor, the audio quality is absolutely sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.text: It works for what I need. We had 60 mile an hour wind gusts at the campsite the other day. On of the tabs that you put the stake through ripped off. The rest of the tabs held and the shelter held together ok. A few stitches will have it back in fine working order.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia B.

customer_reviews.title: Rips easily
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice set up and was great to put over our porta potty, but the wind blows it to pieces and it rips at the points where it is staked in the ground. Isn't waterproof either. Only positive is it is great for privacy.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie1010

customer_reviews.title: It's light weight & very easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: This item was a definite life saver. I used it as a shelter for my portable potty area. The important thing to remember is to anchor the unit down with the anchors provided. Otherwise, a good wind gush could blow it over. Folding the item back was a little challenging. The include instruction was helpful but you still need to practice the mechanics of folding up the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Chau Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Privacy Tent for privacy
customer_reviews.text: We used this privacy tent on our boat for changing clothes, and a portable potty. Also used it at the beach. Does the job. Make sure you have extra stakes to tie it securely during windy days. The only difficulty we had was trying to fold it back into the storage bag. We had to you tube for videos on how to dismantle lol
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Missed stitching on access flap
customer_reviews.text: For $78, the stitching should secure the zippers to the sides of the tent access flaps, or better yet be double stitched like on a decent tent seam. I find this unit poor quality for the price and would request a refund but beyond the 30-day period.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Boston

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a well constructed product. There only “quality” issue I have with mine is that the carrier bag was not sewn all the way and the adjacent stitches are loose. It is a little shorter then I expected, so if your over 6’ tall it’ll be a little tight. Otherwise it’s a quick and easy shelter to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Jward

customer_reviews.title: Great size, nice quality, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use as a reading nook in my sons room. Wanted something to fit in with the "camping" theme we had. He LOVES it. The size is perfect, it stands up easily on its own but can also be folded up into a small carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Deer

customer_reviews.title: Great Portability!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for clothing changes during photo sessions. It's lightweight, portable and easy to fold once you figure out how. I tried several times following the product video with no luck until I found a youtube video that simplified the explanation and process.
customer_reviews.author: Mocha Baby

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: This does the job very well. It's quick to set up and easy to take down again. Rain fly is easy to put on when needed. Zippers worked well. The stakes are a bit light weight, but they seemed to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: boms

customer_reviews.title: My new she-shed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try and compete with Cheryl's she shed. Cold MN temperatures threatened my cigar time. Roomy enough for a wide director chair with an attached table and a small heater. Blocks the wind and works exactly for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: M.Trafton

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Great little pop up! Used it as a porta-potty with a luggable loo on our camping trip. It rained half of the time so the included rain fly kept it nice and dry inside. Kept the girls very happy having this set up right next to the tent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spiegel

customer_reviews.title: Great product but concerned with a few seems pulling too tight
customer_reviews.text: Great product, large, and easy to set up as described, only concern is 3 or 4 areas where the stitching quality isn’t very good and the seams are too tight surrounding the zippers on the small shower access areas. Was wanting to know from the company if there is a way to reinforce those seams so it won’t pull and rip the fabric anymore, like a patch or something?
customer_reviews.author: Rh

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman and I hike alone. This pop up privacy tent is one of the best things I ever bought! Very good quality, resistant, super easy to fold and it looks great! 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: It does the deed for your deeds
customer_reviews.text: For the price this did the job it was supposed to do. It will be as sturdy as you set it up to be just make sure not to manhandle the zippers or you'll probably rip them off. Condensation was pretty bad in the morning during my test setup but probably to be expected with any of these.
customer_reviews.author: Noneya

product_meta.title: WolfWise Pop Up Privacy Shower Tent Portable Outdoor Sun Shelter Camp Toilet Changing Dressing Room
feature_bullets: UPF 50+ & Water Repellent: The silver coated tent surface reflects sunlight to block up to 98% of the harmful UV rays, protecting the user from the unexpected burning sun. Made of water-repellent polyester with taped seams to keep the inner shelter dry.

Spacious Space & Portability: The tent is 47.2" L x 47.2" W x 74.8" H when open, providing a spacious interior shelter that comfortably fits 1 person. Weighing just 4.8 lbs, it can be folded into a compact size of 23.2" L x 23.2"W x 1.4" H. Ultra-lightweight construction allows for easy transportation with included carrying bag.

Upgraded Version: Compared to an ordinary shower tent, this one is specially designed with an additional rain fly attached on the top to prevent the light rain; 1 removable bottom mat to keep you clean; and 2 zipper windows to deliver great ventilation.

Pop Up Design & Multi-use: Easily pops up and folds down in seconds, no assembly required. WolfWise privacy tent offers a private space for potty use, camping showers and more. It is also ideal for road trips, outdoor shooting, kids’ playing, kids’ dancing competition, clothes vending stands, etc.

Stability: Constructed of galvanized steel for long-lasting performance, it can stand on its own, and is not easy to break and corrode. 4 stakes are equipped to ensure stability on windy days. 1 side bag and 1 clothesline meet your daily needs in the wild.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
